column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I spent 20 years looking for a drug to relieve my depression.. I am able to function now
column3: which I was not able to. I love it. I have little or no side effects.

column1: 17$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$11/25/2010 9:09:28 PM$Reviewer: mswilson
column2: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $3$1$1$My 55 year old father was recently taken off Respridol and put on Abilify. In two weeks time he has lost mobility. He complains of stiff muscles in his legs. He looks like hes ice skating when he's trying to walk
column3: unable to pick up his feet. He's not sleeping and even though i have to hold him up to walk
column4: he still has the urge to get up and walk around every 10-15 mins. It's scary and sad to see my father like this. His eyes that were once bright and twinkled now look dull
column5: dead and aged. The slight change in his mood swings aren't worth all of the side effects!

column1: 18$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$11/6/2010 9:10:37 PM$Reviewer: mel
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$My Doctor put me on Abilify to help kick in the Lexapro
column3: after only 7 days i feel 100% better not quite where i want to be yet but a drastic improvement for me.Can't wait to see what the future holds!My advice to anyone just starting on antidepressants is dont give up the longsuffering is well worth it

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$Ablify was added to my Zoloft approx. 2 months ago. It has been a god send as I have Major Depressive disorder re current.
